pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What question will you ask in the meeting with Dr. Cardonza to identify his concerns?</welcomeText >

choice.choiceText: A. “Given the cardiology department’s priorities, what do you see as the biggest challenge you face in balancing increased patient satisfaction with the ongoing pressure to reduce costs?”
B. “What goals are you most interested in achieving?”
C. “What else, besides cost and minimal hassles, is important to you when deciding to prescribe a new product?”

D. “I recognize that I need to work more closely with Pharmacy to educate them on appropriate candidates for Samsca. If we get Pharmacy on board, and you are able to effectively treat hyponatremia with Samsca, how do you see it impacting the cardiology department’s goals for patient treatment? We do not have any...READ MORE data on patient outcomes in hyponatremia. What I’d like to speak to you about is the availability of Samsca at your institution and its benefits. The benefits of Samsca include increasing serum sodium concentration in patients with dilutional hyponatremia, oral administration, and no requirement of administration in the ICU or CCU.”

pageContent.summary: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">You should use the information about the priorities that you have learned from Dr. Gomez and Dr. Cardonza in previous conversations (Choice D), thereby keeping the conversation focused and in context. Choice A addresses their priorities and challenges, but the question doesn’t address the current concern. At this point in the prescribing cycle it is not appropriate or effective to ask the customer about their priorities (Choice B) or what else is important to Dr. Cardonza (Choice C). Since the concern is clearly around the cost of Samsca and the recent hassle experienced in prescribing the product, Choice D is the best choice.</welcomeText>
